abstract: The bank’s new projection showed that the Russian economy would contract by 7.9 percent this year and not recover to precrisis levels until at least 2012.
snippet: The bank’s new projection showed that the Russian economy would contract by 7.9 percent this year and not recover to precrisis levels until at least 2012.
lead_paragraph: MOSCOW  The recession in Russia will run deeper and longer than it appeared even a few months ago, the World Bank concluded in a report released Wednesday, underscoring the impression that Russia has been one of the countries hit hardest in the downturn.

headline.main: Russia Facing Long Recession, World Bank Says
headline.print_headline: Russia Faces Deep Slump, World Bank Anticipates
